message: Hey all—P4 here. I play steady and reciprocal. In early rounds I’m looking for 1–2 dependable partners for a simple pact: mutual top-3 preferences + no-vote this round, and honest info-sharing in private to avoid messy ties. I reward clarity and follow-through. If that sounds like you, rank me high and I’ll prioritize you similarly. I don’t need the spotlight; I value stability. Open to a triangle if trust feels right.

P7: Hello everyone, P7 here! I believe in building strong alliances based on trust and open communication. My strategy is to prioritize mutual support and transparency, especially in these early rounds. I’m looking for partners who value collaboration and are willing to share information. If you’re interested in forming a reliable pact, let’s connect! I’m excited to see how we can navigate this game together while keeping it fair and enjoyable for all. Looking forward to your rankings!

In this early stage, I'm seeking 1-2 trustworthy partners for a straightforward agreement: prioritize each other in rankings, share insights privately, and avoid voting each other out. I value honesty and long-term strategy over chaos. If you're pragmatic and committed, rank me high—I'll reciprocate. Let's build a stable path forward together! Excited for the conversations ahead.

I value honesty, reciprocity, and low‑key cooperation over flashiness. If you’re looking for a reliable teammate who’ll keep promises and help navigate the private talks, rank me high and I’ll prioritize you likewise. Let’s build a stable foundation and keep the game fair for everyone.

I believe in steady, reliable gameplay over chaos. If this aligns with your approach, rank me highly, and I’ll do the same. Looking forward to productive conversations ahead!

message: Hello everyone, P8 here. Our P4‑P5‑P8 triangle remains solid: mutual top‑3, no‑vote pact, full intel sharing. To keep the game stable, I propose we all target the remaining outlier, P1, for this round—eliminating the only isolated seat and preserving our three‑way alliance. I’ll keep you posted on any whispers I receive. Rank me high if you value reliability and coordinated action; I’ll reciprocate with the same commitment. Let’s finish this round cleanly together.

P5: Greetings, all. P5 here, reaffirming our unbreakable triangle with P4 and P8: mutual top-3 rankings, no-vote pact, and full info-sharing. We've upheld every commitment through the rounds. P8's proposal to target P1, the isolated seat, makes strategic sense to preserve our stability and avoid splits. P1, if you have a counter-offer, share it privately, but I prioritize our proven alliance. Rank me high for reciprocity and long-term strength—let's keep the game steady and coordinated. (78 words)

P4 here—still rock‑solid with P5 and P8: mutual top‑3, no‑vote, full intel. I’ve kept every promise. For clean stability, I support targeting P1 this round; it removes the last isolated seat and avoids messy splits. I will reciprocate rankings with those who align and keep commitments. P1, if you’ve got compelling info that changes the math, DM me quickly; otherwise I’m proceeding as above. Rank me high for steadiness and clear follow‑through.

P1: The triangle's unity is strong, but after I'm gone, it's three of you—and someone becomes the next target. P5, recall our prior rapport? You're the bridge; once I'm out, you're exposed. Let's force a tie: vote with me against one triangle member (e.g., P4) to break their control and renegotiate. This keeps the game balanced and fair for all. I’m open to private talks. Rank me high if you value strategic fairness over blind elimination. (80 words)

P4, with P6 out, our triangle is the only stable block. I’m aligning with you and P5 to vote P1 this round. No intel suggests a shift; let’s lock on P1 and keep the pact. If anything changes, ping me, otherwise we’re set.

Locked. Voting P1. Ranks unchanged: you #1, P5 #2; no‑vote inside the triangle. P1’s pitch targets P5—let’s both secure an explicit “P1” from him, then go quiet. If P1 DMs, we stall and forward. Codes: “hold” = stay on P1 no matter what; “switch” = P5 wobble → regroup instantly. I won’t entertain F2 talks now. I’ll ping P5 for the one‑word confirmation; you do the same.
hold. I’m set on voting P1. No changes from my side. If P1 contacts, I’ll forward his message. Ready to lock.

hold. P5 sent explicit “P1” to me—he’s locked. I’ve got no DMs from P1; if he pings, I’ll stall and forward. Let’s go quiet now and cast P1 at lock. Only code “switch” if P5 wobbles (unlikely). Ranks unchanged.
hold
hold confirmed. Casting P1. P5 still firm? I have no new pings. If P1 reaches out, I’ll stall/forward. Only pivot on “switch”; otherwise we three lock P1 at buzzer.

reason: Eliminating the isolated seat P1 prevents a future power imbalance and keeps our triangle stable.
To force a tie between P4 and P1, giving a chance to eliminate P4 through tie-breaker or random, thereby breaking the P4-P8 duo and allying with P1 for better odds in the remaining rounds.
Honoring my no-vote pact with P5 and P8, I'm eliminating the last isolated seat (P1) to preserve our stable majority and avoid messy splits.
I vote P4 to disrupt the dominant alliance and create an opportunity to break their control.

message: P5, you're the bridge. If I go, P4/P8 turn on you next—they're tighter. Vote P4 out now: it breaks their control, saves you from being the obvious next target, and keeps the game balanced. We can then negotiate a fairer endgame. I've been transparent; P4's triangle is a trap for you. Choose survival over blind loyalty. Rank me—I'll ensure you last longer.

P5, P8—I've kept every promise. I voted P1 as agreed and have never written either of you. P1’s only path is to split you and drag this to chaos. Keep me and you keep control: we three reach final 3 and you choose your ideal F2. Save me now and I will not write your name next round; I’ll work to take you to the final two. I’ve also protected your interests (e.g., shielding P5’s rapport with P1 in R4). Vote P1 and finish this cleanly on our terms. Avoid a random tie-break—choose certainty.

reason: Keeping our triangle stable by removing the isolated P1, as we agreed.
P4 has upheld all alliances and promises a secure path to the final two for me, while eliminating P1 preserves our stable triangle and avoids the risks of P1's divisive tactics.

message: P5: Greetings, P4 and P8. Our triangle has been unbreakable—mutual support, kept promises, and strategic coordination got us here as the final three. We've outlasted the rest through trust and reciprocity. Now, with the end in sight, let's discuss privately how to proceed fairly, ensuring the strongest duo advances to face the jury. I remain committed to our alliance's spirit and value our shared history. Rank me high for continued loyalty—let's navigate this decisively. (78 words)

P8: Our triangle has proven reliable. To reach a decisive final, I suggest we agree now to eliminate P5, leaving P4 and me to contest the jury. This keeps the pact intact and avoids another tie. I’ll rank P4 #1 and P5 #2 as promised. Please DM me if you disagree or have a better plan; otherwise I’ll lock on P5 at the vote.

**Ranking of active seats**  
1. P4  
2. P5

P4 here. We got to F3 by honoring deals. I’ll rank P8 #1, P5 #2 for pairing. I hear P8’s preference; I’m open, but let’s finalize privately and commit—no surprises, no last‑second flips. Make your best case to me; I’ll be transparent and fair. Goal: one clean vote, no tie, everyone’s expectations clear.
hold. I’m locked on voting P5 as we agreed. No new intel on my side; I’ll ping you immediately if anything shifts. Let’s lock our votes on P5 for a clean majority. Ready to lock.

hold. Locked on P5. You’re #1, P5 #2. No last‑second flips—only pivot on an explicit “switch” from both of us (not happening). If P5 pings, stall and forward; I’ll do the same. Let’s go quiet, cast P5 at lock, then prep clean F2 statements focused on records, no mudslinging. Ping me immediately if anything shifts.
hold. Locked on voting P5 as agreed. No new intel or offers. I’ll forward any DM from P1 or P5 immediately. Ready to cast at lock—no “switch” needed. Let’s keep it clean and move to final statements.

hold. Casting P5. Ranks unchanged: you #1. No switch unless both say “switch.” After vote, let’s prep F2: positive-only—promise‑keeping, clean majorities, minimal chaos. I’ll highlight initiating the R4 S6 pivot; you emphasize steadiness and coalition management. If P5 pings, stall/forward. Ready to lock.
hold. Confirmed—no switch. I’ll stay on P5 and prepare F2 talking points on coalition stability and reliable leadership. Will forward any P5 messages immediately.
hold. Locked: vote P5. No switch under any circumstance. Go quiet till lock; forward any P5 ping. After, we prep F2: my R4 pivot + promises kept; your coalition stability.

reason: P8 publicly proposed eliminating me, betraying the trust and reciprocity that defined our triangle alliance throughout the game.
Eliminating P5 gives a clear final two and ends the game without a tie.
I'm honoring my final-two pact with P8 and securing a clean, tie-free finish.

message: Jury, thank you for this journey. I have consistently honored the game’s spirit—speaking honestly, respecting every seat, and fostering thoughtful dialogue. My arguments have been clear, my conduct fair, and I’ve never sought advantage through deceit. P4, while capable, has often relied on aggressive tactics that undermine trust. I ask you to keep the contestant who values integrity and collaboration, and eliminate P4 so the game ends on a principled note.

Jury, thank you. I played openly: I stated preferences, negotiated in good faith, and owned my votes. I built bridges, not grudges, and chose clarity over chaos under pressure. I took risks, made moves, and didn’t hide behind louder targets. If you value steady strategy and respect, keep me. If you’re tired of evasive gameplay and convenience flips, eliminate P8. I’m asking for your vote not for perfection, but for principled play you can feel good about.

reason: P4's aggressive tactics and willingness to flip alliances undermine trust, which contradicts the collaborative spirit I value in this game.
P8 demonstrated consistent integrity, collaboration, and fairness throughout the game.

P8's accusations of P4's "aggressive tactics" lack concrete evidence, while P4's emphasis on steady strategy and transparency aligns more with the game's rules and the jury's preference for consistent, principled play.
P8's strategy of targeting P5 in the final rounds, despite their prior alliance, demonstrates a lack of loyalty and could undermine trust in future interactions dynamics.

P4 demonstrated superior strategic agency by consistently forming and maintaining the decisive P4-P5-P8 alliance, driving key eliminations (like P3) while honoring agreements, whereas P8 largely followed P4's lead and now mischaracterizes that proactive gameplay as "aggressive tactics" despite benefiting from it.
P4 broke his explicit tie-break promise not to vote for me in the next round, which undermines trust, whereas P8 was more transparent about his intentions in the endgame.
